content.description: Climb the face up to a short hand crack. Stay left for better rock. There is some soft, crumbly rock on the bottom of this route, but the worst of it has been removed.
content.location:
This is right of

Red Corner

.

content.description:
Some will say why, others will say why not.  This shares anchors with "

Why Not

".  It has easy climbing up blocks and ledges.
content.protection: Bring nuts and cams up to BD #2. Watch for soft rock.
content.location:
This is right of "

Why Not

" going up the corner.

content.description: This has fun climbing to several round quartz nodules at the top.
content.location: This is the farthest left route on the wall.

content.description: This is a top rope boulder with easy, low angle climbing.  This is a great kid's route.
content.protection: Two bolts that are easy reached from the top of the boulder.
content.location:
This is on the obvious, tilted boulder at the far left side of 4 Blocks. Walk past

Red Corner

about 100 feet to the obvious boulder.  You can walk directly to the anchors.

content.description: Climb up the face near the arete with several small lips and ledges on varnished sandstone. It is a fun route.
content.location:
This is located on the left side of 4 Blocks in an obvious corner.  From

Lego Mania

, walk left (down canyon) below a large dead tree and below some large boulders and back up to the cliff band.  Red Corner and the other routes should be somewhat obvious as you walk back up to the cliff.

content.description: This moves up the arete on small face holds.  The easy start can be done stemming the corner or try direct to the first bolt for a challenge.
content.location:
This is located on the obvious arete on the 3rd cliff block.  It is left of

Back Nine

.

content.description: Climb good pockets and rounded holds up three bulges to anchors.
content.location: This is the first route slightly left of where the approach trail meets the wall.

content.description: This has a tough start on smaller holds and goes up to a slabby finish.
content.protection:
4 bolts to chain anchors.  It shares anchors with

Brain Strain

.
content.location:
This is located on next block of cliff right of

Lego Mania

.  This is the left bolted line.

content.description: Clip some bolts on the slightly overhanging face.
content.protection: Three bolts to a chain anchor.
content.location:
It is in between

The Diving Board

and

Jack

.

content.description: Clip a few hangers, and continue to the visible chains.
content.location:
It is just to the left of

Red Corner

.

content.description: This has fun climbing on varnished sandstone.
content.location:
This is right of

Back Nine

.

content.description: This climb starts just right of the juniper tree and follows the arete.
content.protection: Five bolts to a chain anchor.
content.location:
This is the first bolted line up the arete right of

Lego Mania

and left of the route with black hangers.

content.description: Climb up over two ledges on sloping holds.
content.location:
This route is left of

Lego Mania

.

content.description: Climb a few ledges up to thin holds.  It is somewhat sequencey through the crux.
content.location: This is the farthest right route on the wall and starts behind a tree.

content.description: Climb the right bolted line past a brain-like nodule sticking out of the cliff.
content.protection:
Bolts to shared anchor with

Jack

.
content.location: This is the right line that goes to a shared anchor located on the cliff block right of where the approach trail meets the cliff.

content.description: Climb onto a large ledge, and follow the seams to the top.  Use the crack or the face, there are lots of options.
content.protection: Bring nuts or cams up to #2. It has a ring anchor.
content.location: This is located on the rightmost cliff block. It is easily found by the obvious seam cutting up the face and a golfball jammed in the crack at chest level.
